qas.question: What type of music did Madonna experimented with in Music?
Most of the songs in Music are what type of songs?
What type of songs are in Confessions of a Dance floor?
What type of songs does Hard Candy have?
MDNA focuses on which type of music?

context: Madonna experimented with more <a0_0>folk and acoustic<a0_0/> music in Music (2000) and American Life (2003). A change was noted in the content of the songs in Music, with most of them being <a1_0>simple love songs,<a1_0/> but with an underlying tone of melancholy. According to Q magazine, American Life was characterized by "a thumping techno rhythm, liquid keyboard lines, an acoustic chorus and a bizarre Madonna rap." The "conventional rock songs" of the album were suffused with dramatic lyrics about patriotism and composition, including the appearance of a gospel choir in the song "Nothing Fails". Madonna returned to pure <a2_0>dance songs<a2_0/> with Confessions on a Dance Floor, infusing club beats and retro music with the lyrics about paradoxical metaphors and reference to her earlier works. Madonna moved to <a3_0>urban direction<a3_0/> with Hard Candy (2008), mixing R&B and hip hop music with dance tunes. MDNA (2012) largely focused in <a4_0>electronic dance music<a4_0/>, which she has embraced since Ray of Light.
